items.title: Live:Nifty In Correction Zone, Should You Catch The Falling Knife? DMart, Zomato In F&O|Opening Bell
items.description: The significant selling pressure in the market continued, with the Nifty 50 losing more than one percent for the second consecutive session on November 13. This was driven by nervousness in global markets and a spike in CPI inflation. The index formed a long bearish candlestick once again and eventually hit the 200-day EMA support at 23,540. If the index decisively falls below this level, it may reach the second target (around 23,200) of the Head and Shoulders pattern in the upcoming sessions. However, on the upside, the levels to watch are 23,900-24,000, experts said. Also watch out for stocks like DMart, Zomato, Hero Moto among others. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with big market experts on how to navigate this selloff. Kunal Rambhia, Fund Manager, The Streets decodes the chart setup while Ajay Srivastav, CEO, Dimensions Corporate Finance Services and Mahesh Patil, CIO, Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC share their market insights.

items.title: Buy Mahindra and Mahindra; target of Rs 3262: LKP Research
items.description: LKP Research is bullish on Mahindra and Mahindra has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 3262 in its research report dated November 13, 2024.

items.description: Despite muted sales growth for Royal Enfield, brokerages anticipate a rebound in the second half of FY25, backed by a change in focus towards growth, two-wheeler premiumisation trend and festive sales.

items.title: Garden Reach shares snap five-day losing streak after strong Q2 earnings
items.description: For the September quarter, Garden Reach's Profit After Tax (PAT) climbed 21 percent year-on-year to Rs 98 crore, up from Rs 81 crore in Q2FY24.

items.description: PI Industries initially projected an 18-20 percent revenue growth for FY25, but has since revised its forecast firstly to 15 percent, and then further lower to high-single digits.

items.title: Varun Beverages stock climbs 5% as firm launches Rs 7,500 crore QIP
items.description: Varun Beverages got an approval for the QIP in October, with funds to be used for investments in subsidiaries, joint ventures, and associates, as well as for expanding its product portfolio, entering new markets, and making strategic acquisitions.

items.title: From ULIPs to FDI, HDFC Life’s Vibha Padalkar shares her views on all
items.description: From growing share of ULIPs, to improving persistency ratio and whether the industry as a whole has settled down after a series of changes in regulations, Vibha Padalkar, MD & CEO, HDFC Life opens up on these topics on more in this Moneycontrol exclusive.

items.description: The company experienced demand traction in October, while new products and capacity expansion will act as growth levers

items.title: Protean eGov Technologies| Open digital ecosystems could be the future growth driver
items.description:
Protean is a market leader in the provision of e-governance services in taxation-related infrastructure and social security welfare projects such as the National Pension Scheme (NPS) and the Atal Pension Yojana. It also has a subsidiary for the account aggregation business, which is regulated by the RBI.

Protean’s multi-term population-scale projects ensure visibility of revenues. Moreover, the company’s offerings cater to varied customer segments, including businesses and retail consumers apart from the government, leading to low concentration risk. Protean’s business model is asset-light, enjoys high operating leverage, and has a track record of healthy profitability and cash generation.

items.title: Shilpa Medicare share jumps 8% as Q2 earnings impress
items.description: The revenue boost was attributed to robust growth in emerging markets alongside licensing success in the formulation and biologics segments, with the biologics business reporting a positive net profit for the first time.

items.title: CNBC-TV18 Global Leadership Summit: Piyush Goyal Urges RBI to Cut Rates, Predicts Inflation Drop
items.description: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal urged the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to cut interest rates, arguing that food inflation shouldn’t drive this decision. He clarified that this was his personal view, not the government's stance. Goyal expects inflation to drop by December, noting that the Modi government has maintained historically low inflation levels. Addressing recent foreign investor exits, he advised a long-term investment perspective. India’s retail inflation rose to a 14-month high of 6.21% in October, exceeding RBI’s 2%-6% target. The RBI, cautious about inflation risks, recently kept its repo rate at 6.5%, citing potential economic risks.

items.title: Food delivery giants face off: How Swiggy measures up to Zomato?
items.description: Zomato may be ahead in the food delivery and quick commerce race, but its high valuation could give Swiggy the perfect chance to steal the spotlight and outshine with its stock performance.

items.title: Apollo Tyres shares halt 4-day losing streak on in-line Q2 results
items.description: In Europe, Apollo Tyres gained market share in the ultra-high performance segment (UHP), which grew to 46 percent of total sales from 39 percent in the previous year.
